  • Method Details

    • translateAndScale

      public static void translateAndScale(javafx.scene.Node node, double posX, double posY, double scaleX, double scaleY)
      Simultaneously translates and scales the given node over a short duration.

      Creates a TranslateTransition to move the node to the target X and Y coordinates, and a ScaleTransition to resize the node to the specified scale factors. Both transitions run in parallel.

      Parameters:
      node - the UI element to animate
      posX - the target X position (in pixels) relative to the node's origin
      posY - the target Y position (in pixels) relative to the node's origin
      scaleX - the factor by which the node's width will be scaled
      scaleY - the factor by which the node's height will be scaled

    • blindingEffect

      public static void blindingEffect(javafx.scene.Node node, double startSecond)
      Applies a continuous fading (twinkle) effect to the specified node.

      Utilizes a FadeTransition that oscillates the node's opacity between fully visible and partially transparent indefinitely, with an initial delay.

      Parameters:
      node - the UI element to animate
      startSecond - the delay in seconds before the fade effect begins

    • fadeInEffect

      public static void fadeInEffect(javafx.scene.Node node)
      Scales the node down from a large size into its natural dimensions, creating a 'zoom-in' appearance.

      Initializes the node at ten times its normal scale, then animates it back to its original size using an ease-out interpolation.

      Parameters:
      node - the UI element to animate
